alert.note: Alert for Municipality of Skagway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 08 at 4:31AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...The Taiya River near areas along low lying portions of the Chilkoot Trail. * WHEN...Until 800 PM AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rivers or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 427 AM AKDT, River gauge reports indicate rises in water levels from rapid snowmelt is occurring, and will cause minor flooding. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly, especially near the Taiya River. - For Taiya River near Skagway: At 4:00am the stage was 16.08 feet. Minor Flood Stage is 16.5 feet. Forecast: A crest around 16.7 feet is expected around 10:00am Sunday. Impacts: At 16.5 feet: Portions of the first few miles of the Chilkoot Trail will begin to inundate with water to ankle depth. At 17.0 feet: The National Park Service advises against boating and other recreational water-based activities on the Taiya River. Trail orientation and navigation begins to become difficult and may hinder route-finding for several hundred feet. Water will be knee deep or higher in places along the lower portions of the trail.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
